channel.title: Finance
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from Finance, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: ‘Big Short’ investor Michael Burry revives his short bet against Tesla, calling the stock ‘ridiculously overvalued’
item.description: Burry first shorted Tesla in 2021 but exited the trade months later.

item.title: Progress In Fight Against Malaria, As New Treatment Shows Promise
item.description: The anti-malarial GanLum's Phase 3 data highlight the drug’s potential to further combat the threat of antimalarial drug resistance in Africa.

item.title: Musk says AI and robotics are 'only' things that can solve massive US debt crisis
item.description: Elon Musk claims AI and robotics are the only solution to America's $38 trillion debt crisis, predicting dramatic economic changes within three years.

item.title: Trump economic advisor Kevin Hassett touts ‘best Black Friday that we've ever seen’ as holiday spending surges
item.description: National Economic Council Director Kevin Hassett attributes record Black Friday and holiday spending to increased incomes and lower inflation under th...

item.title: How a park bench meeting led to Aflac’s $200 million mascot idea
item.description: “Quack, quack, Aflac became the idea,” CEO Dan Amos told Fortune. The adoption of the avian mascot has coincided with a 621% run-up in share price.

item.title: Who is Kevin Hassett? The rumored Fed pick says inflation is ‘way down,’ sees ‘political bias’ in jobs data, and suggested firing Powell over a renovation
item.description: “If you’d asked me a year ago, I would have said I think Kevin would be a good pick. I wouldn’t say that today. Kevin has been incredibly dishonest.”

item.title: AI Agents And Workplace Culture Impact Enterprise Software
item.description: Discover how AI agents, evolving business models, and workplace culture will reshape enterprise software by 2026, driving innovation and productivity.

item.title: New FDA-approved glasses can slow nearsightedness in kids
item.description: While the technology has previously been available in Europe, Asia and other parts of the world, it’s now rolling out in the U.S.

item.title: United XR Merges Two Immersive Conferences In Brussels
item.description: UnitedXR Europe debuts in Brussels next week, uniting Stereopsia and AWE Europe, and featuring new immersive tech for training, simulation, games and ...

item.title: Trump Vodka Becomes Available For Pre-Orders After 13-Year Hiatus
item.description: The spirit is the latest licensed product to be marketed under the Trump name branding.

item.title: Bitcoin takes another plunge, chances of reclaiming $100,000 by year end drop to 24% on prediction markets
item.description: Bettors on Kalshi are putting their money on bearish positions.

item.title: Adaptive, Judicious, Collaborative, Creative: The Traits Leaders Seek And Workers Need

item.title: Recent college grads are losing their edge in the job market, study shows
item.description: The unemployment gap between college and high school graduates has reached its lowest level in decades, according to a new report from the Cleveland F...

item.title: What to Know About China's DeepSeek AI
item.description: The Chinese upstart says it has trained high-performing AI models cheaply, without using the most advanced chips.

item.title: Reid Hoffman Raises $24.6 Million for AI Cancer-Research Startup
item.description: The LinkedIn co-founder is starting Manas AI with “The Emperor of All Maladies” author Siddhartha Mukherjee.

item.title: Can an App Replace a Personal Trainer? I Tested Nearly a Dozen to Find Out
item.description: Apps can add flexibility and freshness to your routine. Just try not to get injured.
